title: 107_hr5404
content: The "Social Security Fairness Act of 2002" is cited as the short title. An amendment to the Social Security Act includes a new subsection regarding the termination of monthly insurance benefits upon death. The Social Security Act is amended to include a new subsection regarding the termination of monthly insurance benefits upon death, specifying that if an individual dies within the first 15 days of a month, their benefit will be 50% of the original amount rounded up to the nearest dollar. This applies after all other adjustments have been made. The Social Security Act is amended to include a new subsection stating that if an individual dies within the first 15 days of a month, their benefit will be 50% of the original amount rounded up to the nearest dollar. This applies after all other adjustments have been made. The Social Security Act is amended to state that if an individual dies within the first 15 days of a month, their benefit will be 50% of the original amount rounded up to the nearest dollar. This applies after all other adjustments have been made. Amendments are made regarding the payment of benefits for the month of the recipient's death. Amendments are made to the Social Security Act regarding old-age insurance benefits, wife's insurance benefits, and husband's insurance benefits. Amendments to the Social Security Act include changes to husband's insurance benefits, specifically redesignating subparagraphs and making conforming amendments. Amendments to the Social Security Act involve redesignating subparagraphs and making conforming amendments to sections related to child's and widow's insurance benefits. Amendments to the Social Security Act involve changes to widow's, widower's, mother's, and father's insurance benefits, including conditions for remarriage and death. Amendments to the Social Security Act modify conditions for widow's, widower's, mother's, and father's insurance benefits, including remarriage and death criteria. Amendments to the Social Security Act modify conditions for widow's, widower's, mother's, and father's insurance benefits, including remarriage and death criteria. The changes include adjustments to disability insurance benefits, benefits at age 72 for certain uninsured individuals, and exemption from the maximum benefit cap. Benefits at age 72 for uninsured individuals are modified under the Social Security Act. Additionally, an exemption from the maximum benefit cap is introduced. Exemption from maximum benefit cap is granted regardless of individual benefits under specific sections upon death. Lump-sum death payments are increased. Section 202(i) of the Social Security Act is amended to update the applicable dollar amount for calendar years, with the Commissioner of Social Security determining and publishing the amount annually. The Commissioner of Social Security determines and publishes the applicable dollar amount for each calendar year based on the national average wage index, rounding to the nearest multiple of $5.00. The amendments made by this Act will be effective for deaths occurring after 90 days from the enactment date.
